column2: MONTANA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Montana

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. When there is a _______ at an intersection, you should come to a complete stop, yield to cross traffic/pedestrians, and then proceed when clear.
column4: a flashing red light

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn

column2: 3. Before entering a traffic circle, drivers must slow down and yield to ___________ in the traffic circle.
column4: vehicles

column2: 4. When driving on slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: brake harder than usual.

column2: 5. If involved in an accident, drivers should:
column4: stop their vehicle at or near the scene.
column6: turn off the ignitions of wrecked vehicles.
column8: avoid standing or walking in traffic lanes.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Do not enter
column10: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Steep grade ahead

column2: 8. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column6: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column8: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column8: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.

column2: 10. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column8: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column10: when passing is restricted by parked cars.

column2: 11. To safely cross a railroad, drivers should:
column4: drive across quickly if a train is approaching, or if it is too close, stop and then back up.
column6: listen and look both ways, then proceed if it is safe to do so.
column8: look both ways only if the red light is flashing.
column10: stop within 10 feet of all railroad crossings.

column2: 12. When driving on wet roads, you should remember:
column4: to stay farther behind the vehicle ahead of you.
column6: you should give yourself additional time to stop.
column8: driving on wet roads can cause hydroplaning.

column2: 13. If a bus has signaled and is pulling back onto the roadway, you must:
column4: yield.
column10: honk to let them know you’re there.

column2: 14. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column6: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column8: their lane has a solid yellow center line.

column2: 15. When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:
column4: using the outside rearview mirror.
column6: checking the rearview and outside mirrors.
column10: turning your head and glancing over your shoulder.

column2: 16. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
column6: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.
column8: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.

column2: 17. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column4: take precedence over

column2: 18. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column8: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column10: The driver can legally pass red lights.

column2: 19. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column6: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column8: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.

column2: 20. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column6: they must not make a right turn.

column2: 21. When turning or changing lanes, drivers must:
column4: signal only if there is traffic.
column6: signal only when driving at night.
column8: signal only when driving in traffic at night.
column10: always signal their intentions even when there are no vehicles.

column2: 22. _____________ lights indicate that drivers should slow down and proceed with caution at an intersection.
column4: Red

column2: 23. Parking is not allowed:
column4: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 24. Which of the following is a common cause of a traffic collisions?
column4: Excessive speed for conditions.

column2: 25. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you increase the chance of a crash.
column6: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

column2: 26. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column6: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column8: increase your speed and move to the left.
column10: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 27. When changing lanes, you should not:
column4: check your side and rear view mirrors.
column8: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.
column10: use the inside rearview mirror to check for blind spots

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column4: Detour ahead

column2: 29. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: remove the sign and move forward.
column6: look for a detour or another route.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.

column2: 30. This sign is a:
column4: guide sign.

column2: 31. This sign means:
column4: No passing zone ahead.
column6: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column8: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 32. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
column4: increase

column2: 33. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column8: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column10: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

column2: 31. This sign means:
column4: No passing zone ahead.
column6: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column8: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 32. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
column4: increase

column2: 33. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column8: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column10: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
